cves.description: Critical buffer overflow vulnerability in Apache HTTP Server allows remote code execution through malformed HTTP headers. Attackers can exploit this to gain complete system control.
Critical use-after-free vulnerability in OpenSSL that could lead to remote code execution during TLS handshake. Affects encrypted communications.
Privilege escalation vulnerability in Node.js allows local attackers to execute arbitrary code with elevated permissions through malicious package installations.
SQL injection vulnerability in PostgreSQL allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary SQL commands through specially crafted queries in specific stored procedures.
Authentication bypass vulnerability in nginx allows attackers to bypass authentication mechanisms through malformed request headers in specific configurations.
Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in MySQL Workbench allows attackers to inject malicious scripts through database comments that execute in administrator sessions.
Command injection vulnerability in Redis allows authenticated users to execute arbitrary system commands through specially crafted Lua scripts.
Server-side request forgery (SSRF) vulnerability in MongoDB allows attackers to make arbitrary HTTP requests from the server through crafted aggregation pipelines.
Information disclosure vulnerability in Python allows local attackers to read sensitive environment variables through race conditions in subprocess handling.
Denial of service vulnerability in Docker allows attackers to crash the daemon through malformed container configuration files with circular dependencies.
Path traversal vulnerability in Git allows attackers to access files outside the repository through specially crafted symbolic links in submodules.
Memory leak vulnerability in Kubernetes allows attackers to exhaust system resources through repeated API calls with large payload bodies.
Integer overflow in Terraform could lead to incorrect resource allocation and potential denial of service when processing extremely large infrastructure configurations.
Improper input validation in Ansible allows execution of unintended tasks through specially crafted playbook variables with template injection.
Cross-site request forgery (CSRF) vulnerability in Jenkins allows attackers to perform unauthorized actions through social engineering of authenticated users.
Weak cryptographic algorithm usage in Vault could allow attackers to decrypt sensitive secrets with sufficient computational resources over extended time periods.
Information leakage vulnerability in Prometheus exposes internal network topology and service metadata through unprotected metrics endpoints.
Minor timing attack vulnerability in Grafana could theoretically reveal information about dashboard permissions through response time analysis.
Verbose error messages in Elasticsearch reveal information about internal system paths and configuration that could aid in reconnaissance.
Missing rate limiting in RabbitMQ management interface allows attackers to perform brute force attacks against credentials without detection.
Improper session timeout configuration in Consul allows inactive sessions to remain valid for extended periods, increasing exposure window.
